task_description:
# API Reference Documentation

Generate comprehensive API reference documentation from docstrings covering all public classes, functions, and configurations. Include examples for common use cases.

## Rationale
Proper API documentation is essential for adoption and reduces support burden. The current README is insufficient for production use. This addresses the known gap of limited documentation.

## User Stories
- As a developer, I want to understand available APIs without reading source code
- As a team lead, I want my team to self-serve on Seeknal knowledge

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All public APIs are documented with descriptions, parameters, and return types
- [ ] Each major module has an overview section explaining its purpose
- [ ] Code examples are included for common patterns
- [ ] Documentation is auto-generated from docstrings and stays in sync with code
- [ ] Searchable documentation site is deployed

patterns.docstring_style: Google style (as seen in FeatureStoreFileOutput, Entity classes)
patterns.existing_docstrings: Some classes have comprehensive docstrings (FeatureStoreFileOutput, OfflineStore, Entity), but many methods lack documentation
patterns.package_structure: Single package 'seeknal' in src/seeknal/ with submodules: featurestore, tasks, cli, exceptions, utils
patterns.no_lib_directory: IMPORTANT: There is NO lib/ directory - only src/seeknal/
patterns.entry_points: CLI via src/seeknal/cli/main.py, library usage via imports from seeknal.*

existing_implementations.description: No existing documentation tooling found. Project uses pyproject.toml with hatchling build backend. Python 3.11+ codebase.
